replies.body: This all sounds like a really cool revolutionized new league of legends. But it also sounds like it's gonna take a lot of time. Could We get some URF up in this while we wait??
This guy gets it.

Guys don't eat these because they are *Poro Snax* and notice how they have only one bite out of them maybe its because someone took a bite out of it to try it and it was so good they died or it was super good but it only doesn't kill Poros.
That makes too much sense
or maybe each cookie is tested for quality that's why a piece is missing. Each cookie is taste tested to make sure they are PoroPerfect.

dude anyone who wants urf back gets it
I logged in just to up vote this.
so true, so true
I just want to {{summoner:11}}  people already. This brings back memories from when i just started playing and was wondering why I kept missing my smite on Champions.
{{champion:86}} this is the only champion in the game who can use{{summoner:11}} on enemy champions. he is also the only one who can mitigate true damage :)

So I don't have to come back here for a pointless bronze argument. Here is a link with a Red confirming that Garens W doesn't mitigate true damage -.- http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?p=25226949 Have a nice day.
Please I knew this was coming way before any of you, just look at my summoner name.
*Baby don't hurt me*

If they keep the PBE jungle changes then there is an upgraded hunters machete that allows you to smite people. And all the machete upgrades make different changes to your smite. IMO Jungling looks awful now though. I don't feel it should be THAT difficult just to clear.

Actually, from watching Stonewall008 and Pawnce, it looks like pretty much any champ can clear fine as long as they follow the right clear path. Which usually entails starting at Gromp or Krug for the smite buff, then wolves or chickens (kill the little chickens first or you'll get hurt) then getting red or blue.

Nunu, Warwick, & Fiddle can, of course, clear however they want.
